wikipedia_page.main: Job Edward Lousley or Ted Lousley (18 September 1907 – 6 January 1976) was a banker by career, a renowned amateur botanist and an author of many publications including ″Wild Flowers of Chalk and Limestone″ (Number 16) in the New Naturalist series and the first flora of the Isles of Scilly published in 1971.

response: Sherrin was remembered by his colleagues as highly successful, a "born teacher", and an "admirable" general naturalist and field botanist. Job Edward Lousley stated that "Sherrin  transformed the collections of the South London Botanical Institute to such an extent that few people using them today can realise how much they owe to his efforts."
